properties.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 15 at 4:12AM PST until January 16 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* CHANGES...Upgrade from a watch to a warning. Increasing
confidence.

* WHAT...South winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 65 mph
expected.

* WHERE...Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area.

* WHEN...From 1 AM to 1 PM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees, fences, and
powerlines leading to power outages. Travel will be difficult,
especially for high profile vehicles with travel restrictions
possible. Severe turbulence and delays for air travel.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind prone locations will begin to become
strong and gusty overnight with widespread strong winds likely
from pre-dawn through midday Thursday.
properties.instruction:
Now is the time Secure loose outdoor items such as patio
furniture, holiday decorations, and trash cans before winds
increase which could blow these items away. The best thing to do
is prepare ahead of time by making sure you have extra food and
water on hand, flashlights with spare batteries and/or candles in
the event of a power outage.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 1 PM PST THURSDAY
